question.Title: list out of range error when python-docx reads a table of which the border's not aligned
question.Body:
I am parsing a table (which looks like the image below) in Word docx file by using python-docx. But when it reads the table below it throws an error.I've noticed that there is a tiny "crack" at the right-end border of the table as I circled red in the picture. If I manually align the right-end border, my code will be fine. But isn't there a clever way to solve it?

from docx import Documentdocument = Document(u'D:\\1.docx')tables = document.tablesprint(tables[0].rows[0].cells[0].text)

The error is:

Traceback (most recent call last):  File "C:\Users\lenovo\Anaconda2\envs\py3\lib\site-packages\IPython\core\interactiveshell.py", line 2862, in run_code    exec(code_obj, self.user_global_ns, self.user_ns)  File "<ipython-input-168-61cbbaa7e1a8>", line 1, in <module>    tables[0].rows[0].cells[0].text  File "C:\Users\lenovo\Anaconda2\envs\py3\lib\site-packages\docx\table.py", line 384, in cells    return tuple(self.table.row_cells(self._index))  File "C:\Users\lenovo\Anaconda2\envs\py3\lib\site-packages\docx\table.py", line 106, in row_cells    return self._cells[start:end]  File "C:\Users\lenovo\Anaconda2\envs\py3\lib\site-packages\docx\table.py", line 173, in _cells    cells.append(cells[-col_count])IndexError: list index out of rangeDuring handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:Traceback (most recent call last):  File "C:\Users\lenovo\Anaconda2\envs\py3\lib\site-packages\IPython\core\interactiveshell.py", line 2808, in run_ast_nodes    if self.run_code(code, result):  File "C:\Users\lenovo\Anaconda2\envs\py3\lib\site-packages\IPython\core\interactiveshell.py", line 2879, in run_code    self.showtraceback(running_compiled_code=True)TypeError: showtraceback() got an unexpected keyword argument 'running_compiled_code'

Can someone help me?
